alert.note: Alert for Northern Rocky Mountain Front; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued May 17 at 2:34PM MDT until May 20 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations in excess of 6 inches possible, mainly above 5000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 70 mph. * WHERE...The Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, especially on US Highway 89 from Browning to St Mary, US Highway 2 from East Glacier to Marias Pass, and on Looking Glass Road from East Glacier to Kiowa Junction. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening and Friday morning commutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Northern Rocky Mountain Front; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
